titleStmt.title: Tuesday, May 10th. 1659. The Parliament doth resolve and declare, that all persons whatsoever shall pay, and hereby are required to pay in all arrears and growing duties, for customs, excise and new impost, monethly taxes, and all other moneys due and payable to the Common-wealth. ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: Tuesday, May 10th. 1659. The Parliament doth resolve and declare, that all persons whatsoever shall pay, and hereby are required to pay in all arrears and growing duties, for customs, excise and new impost, monethly taxes, and all other moneys due and payable to the Common-wealth. ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Field, Printer to the Parliament. And are to be sold at the seven Stars in Fleetstreet, over against Dunstans Church,

notesStmt.note: Title from first lines of text.
A resolution of Parliament, calling in all arrears of duties for customs, excise, etc.
Order to print signed: Jo. Phelpes, Clerk of the Parliament pro tempore.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
